Forbes and Walker Tea Brokers
MOST COMPREHENSIVE WEBSITE ON TEA
www.forbestea.com
Page 2
Page 2
COMMENTS
Sale No. 18 concluded today was a one-day restricted Auction comprising of a volume of 5.12 M/Kgs and witnessed an overall firm to easier trend in prices with the liquoring Small Leaf teas being discounted by a higher margin.
Ex-Estate offerings were 0.97 M/Kgs. Overall quality was mostly lower to last.
Best Western BOP/BOPF's - Select invoices declined by Rs. 50-80 per kg and more at times towards the closure of the sale. BOP's in the Below Best category were Rs. 50 per kg easier, whilst the corresponding BOPF's declined considerably and were mostly unsold. At the lower end, BOP's were irregular with some correction in prices observed, whilst the corresponding BOPF's declined substantially with less interest. Nuwara Eliya - BOP's were mostly firm, whilst the corresponding BOPF's declined by Rs. 50 per kg and more. Uda Pussellawa BOP/BOPF's were mostly irregular. Uva BOP/BOPF's - Better teas declined considerably due to a lack of suitable bids, whilst the others barely held steady.
High Grown CTC teas - BP1's had hardly any offerings, whilst the PF1's tended lower. Medium Grown CTC teas sold around last levels following quality, whilst the Low Growns were firm to irregularly easier.
Selective buying by shippers to the UK with limited activity from shippers to Japan, China and South Africa, whilst shippers to the Middle East and the CIS were active at lower levels.
Low Growns comprised of 2.1 M/Kgs. The Leafy, Semi-Leafy and Tippy catalogue met with fair demand.
In the Leafy and Semi-Leafy catalogues, select Best and Best BOP1's were firm, whilst the balance together with the OP1's were easier. High-priced OP's maintained, whilst the balance declined. Select Best OPA's declined substantially, whilst the Best and Below Best varieties were lower. However, teas at the bottom sold around last levels. High-priced PEK's together with PEK1's appreciated, whilst the balance were easier. However, teas at the bottom were firm.
In the Tippy catalogue, well-made FBOP's in general were firm, whilst the bolder varieties declined. FF1's, in general, sold around last levels.
In the Premium catalogue, Very Tippy teas together with Best and Below Best sold around last levels, whilst the balance were easier following quality.
World Tea News
FORBES & WALKER TEA BROKERS (PVT) LTD SALE OF - 14TH MAY 2025
Forbes and Walker Tea Brokers
MOST COMPREHENSIVE WEBSITE ON TEA
www.forbestea.com
Page 3
Page 3
MARKET
Better teas were irregular following quality, whilst the Plainer sorts were easier
HIGH GROWN TEAS
BOP
In the Best category, select invoices where quality was maintained, declined by Rs. 20-40 per kg and more, whilst the others declined further. Better Below Best varieties declined by Rs. 40 per kg and more, whilst the others declined further. At the lower end, clean leaf teas sold around last levels, whilst the others declined by Rs. 20-40 per kg following quality. Nuwara Eliya's sold around last levels. Uda Pussellawa's were firm to irregularly lower. Uva's - Better teas declined considerably due to a lack of suitable bids, whilst the others declined by Rs. 20-40 per kg and more.
BOPF
Teas in the Best category declined by Rs. 60-80 per kg following quality, whilst the teas in the Below Best category declined to a lesser extent. At the lower end, clean leaf teas declined by Rs. 20-40 per kg, whilst the others declined considerably and were mostly unsold. Nuwara Eliya's declined by Rs. 50 per kg and more. Uda Pussellawa's - Better teas declined by Rs. 20-40 per kg, whilst the others were firm to irregularly lower. Uva's - Better teas declined considerably due to a lack of suitable bids, whilst the others declined by Rs. 40-60 per kg.
OP/OPA
Well-made varieties were easier by Rs. 40-60 per kg, whilst the others and the poorer sorts declined by a similar margin.
PEKOE/PEKOE1
Flavoury PEK's were easier by Rs. 40-60 per kg. Orthodox Leafy PEK's were easier by Rs. 40-60 per kg, whilst the PEK1's were firm to easier by Rs. 20-40 per kg. Rotovane PEK's were mostly firm to easier by Rs. 50-80 per kg and more at times following inquiry.
FBOP/FBOPF1
Select Best FBOP's were firm around last levels. Orthodox Leafy FBOP's were firm to dearer by Rs. 20-40 per kg, whilst the FBOPF1's were firm to easier by Rs. 20-40 per kg and more at times. Teas at the lower end were firm to easier by Rs. 20 per kg.

MEDIUM GROWN TEAS
BOP
Large Leaf teas sold well, whilst the others were irregularly lower.
BOPF
Better teas declined by Rs. 20-40 per kg, whilst the others and poorer sorts sold around last levels.
OP/OPA
Well-made OP/OPA's were easier by Rs. 40-60 per kg, whilst the others at the lower end were firm to easier by Rs. 20-40 per kg.
PEKOE/PEKOE1
PEK's were easier by Rs. 30-50 per kg. A few Select Best PEK1's held firm, whilst the others and Below Best types were lower by Rs. 40-60 per kg. Mixed varieties were easier by Rs. 30-50 per kg.
FBOP/FBOPF1
A few Select Best FBOP's held firm, whilst the Best and Below Best types were dearer by Rs. 20-40 per kg and more at times. Better FF1's were firm to easier by Rs. 20 per kg. Others in the Best and Below Best categories were easier by Rs. 20-40 per kg, whilst the teas at the lower end were firm to easier by Rs. 30-50 per kg.

Low Grown Best varieties were lower by Rs. 20-40 per kg, whilst the others remained firm.
Best High and Mid Grown CTC teas were lower by Rs. 40 per kg and more, whilst the Below Best varieties together with the poorer sorts were easier by Rs. 20-30 per kg. A few select invoices of the Best Low Grown CTC teas were firm, whilst the others declined by Rs. 40 per kg. The Below Best and poorer varieties remained firm.
DUST
Clean leaf secondaries were easier by Rs. 40 per kg, whilst the poorer sorts declined by a similar margin. Low Grown varieties were easier by Rs. 20-40 per kg.

CROP AND WEATHER
For the period 06 - 12 May 2025
Western/Nuwara Eliya Regions
The Nuwara Eliya and Western regions reported sunny mornings and evening showers. According to the Department of Meteorology, showers are expected in both regions in the week ahead.
Uva/Uda Pussellawa Regions
Bright mornings and evening showers were reported throughout the week in both regions. Heavy showers are expected in the Uva and Uda Pussellawa regions according to the Department of Meteorology.
Low Growns
Sunny mornings and occasional evening showers were reported in the Low Grown Region throughout the week. The Department of Meteorology expects fairly heavy showes in the Low Grown Region in the week ahead.
Crop Intake
The Nuwara Eliya and Western regions maintained the crop intake, whilst the Uva, Uda Pussellawa and Low Grown regions reported a decrease.

MOMBASA AUCTION
SALE OF - 05TH AND 06TH MAY 2025 (SALE NO.18)
Fair general demand prevailed at irregular levels for the 190,519 packages (13,030,295.00 kilos) on offer with 40.84% remaining unsold.
MARKETS
Pakistan Packers were active at lower levels with maintained interest from Yemen and other Middle Eastern countries. Kazakhstan and other CIS states were less active while Bazaar maintained enquiry at easier rates. Afghanistan reduced absorption with UK active but selective. Egyptian Packers lent good support with some participation from Russia and South Sudan; Sudan remained absent. Local Packers showed some interest with Somalia active at the lower end of the market.
OFFERINGS
Leaf Grades                     -    100,000 packages (6,599,961.00 kilos) - 46.80% unsold.
Dust Grades                   -      74,600 packages (5,583,255.00 kilos) - 37.59% unsold.
Secondary Grades          -      15,919 packages (   847,079.00 kilos) - 18.59% unsold.
LEAF GRADES (M2 & M3)
BP1:
Best - Saw good but irregular enquiry, mostly gaining by up to USC34 to easier by up to USC22.
Brighter - Were discounted by up to USC58.
Mediums - KTDA mediums were firm to USC17 dearer but some lines lost up to USC14. Plantation mediums were steady to USC6 above previous rates.
Lower Medium - Were easier by up to USC17.
Plainer - Were firm to USC2 dearer where sold.
PF1:
Best - Eased by up to USC35 but a few selected invoices were  up to USC4 dearer.
Brighter - Met irregular interest and ranged between firm to USC4 above previous levels to easier by up to USC12.
Mediums - KTDA mediums were irregular varying between steady to USC12 dearer to easier by up to USC13. Plantation mediums were firm to USC13 above previous rates to easier by up to USC7.
Lower Medium - Saw irregular demand ranging between steady to USC8 dearer to easier by up to USC10.
Plainer - Were firm to USC6 above last levels to easier by a similar margin.

Lower Medium - Some lines shed up to USC9 while others were mostly dearer by up to USC6.
Plainer - Improved enquiry gaining up to USC15.

BANGLADESH AUCTION
SALE OF - 12TH MAY 2025 (SALE NO. 02)
CTC LEAF: 22,239 packages of tea on offer once again met with a fairly strong demand.
BROKENS/FANNINGS: Well made good liquoring varieties continued to be a strong feature of the sale and witnessed more competition and these could be quoted between Tk.270/- and Tk.300/-. Below best varieties were again a good market but prices eased slightly and these sold between Tk.235/- and Tk.250/-. The remainder again met with a fair demand at slightly easier rates and prices realised between Tk.200/- and Tk.225/-. BLF teas sold fairly well and sold between Tk.160 and 205/-.
DUST: 2,796 packages of tea on offer met with a fairly strong demand. Good liquoring Dusts met with a good demand and prices were irregular closely following quality.  Others also sold at around last levels with hardly any withdrawals. Blenders lent good support with fair interest from the Loose tea buyers.
COMMENTS: Demand this week was a little more widespread with a few more buyers participating in the sale. The best varieties were mostly firm but all others eased a little in line with quality. Blenders continued to lend strong support with more interest from the Loose tea buyers.
All CDs were the strong feature of the sale.
Our Catalogue: (Sale 2) Avg : Tk 211.77, Sold 41.77% , (Sale 1) Avg : Tk 238.84, Sold 73.81%

KOLKATA SALE  CTC MARKET
MARKET REPORT:
Market opened to fair demand. Assams tending easier following decline in quality and witnessing
some outlots. Mediums irregular around last. Plainer Dooars selling around last levels.
BUYING PATTERN:
Western India: Supporting the better teas
HUL: Selective
TCPL: Quiet so far
Exporters: Fair enquiry
Other local/Internal: Fair support
KOLKATA SALE  ORTHODOX MARKET
MARKET REPORT:
Market opened to strong demand. Well made Whole leaf, Brokens and leafy Fannings
selling at firm to occasionally dearer rates. Remainder Whole leaf, Brokens and smaller
Fannings selling at firm rates. Secondaries keenly completed for and selling at levels
higher than last week.
BUYING PATTERN:
Middle East : Mainstay
CIS:  Active
KOLKATA SALE  DUST MARKET
MARKET REPORT:
Market opened to good demand. All sorts irregular with teas showing a drop in quality
tending easier.
BUYING PATTERN:
HUL:  Mainstay
Western India: Good Support
Exporters: Selective
Local and Internal: Very selective
Courtesy- J Thomas & Company Private Limited
JAKARTA AUCTION
SALE OF - 05TH MAY 2025 (SALE NO.18)
CTC LEAF
DEMAND: - Reduced Demand with an increase in offer of CTC leaf by approximately 0.6mkgs than last week.
MARKET: - The total CTC leaf teas sold this week was 73.82 (1,157,807.87kgs) of the total offering of 1,568,499.32Kgs.
BEST:- Modest volume of best liquoring teas were on offer with demand continuing to persist from the local and regional buyers with prices fluctuating irregularly closely following quality.Local and Regional packagers continued to be fairly active.
GOOD:- All sorts in this category met with selective demand and buyers were very price sensitive in this segment. Prices ruled irregular and lower with fair amount of teas remaining unsold due to lesser demand. There were no fanning grade on offer in this segment.Regional packagers, upcountry buyers were choosy and more price sensitive.
BETTER MEDIUM & MEDIUM:- Prices for all categories continued to witness a downward trend of Rs 3 to 5 or more compared to the previous week. The were no price disparity among all sorts of the lower end of the better medium and the top end of the medium category teas. There was a slight better demand on the fanning grade in terms of sale however, the prices dropped by Rs 2 to 3 compared to last week. One of the major blenders improved their off take but were price sensitive whilst the other was fairly active. Western India regional Packateers were selective. Very select buying was seen from the upcountry and local buyers. Exporters continued to be fairly active especially on cleaner, blacker fanning. However, on the larger broken only a select few exporters operated.
PLAINERS:- Reduced demand but with prices declining in the range of Rs 4 to 6 with larger percentage of teas remaining unsold in this segment. Very few exporters were operating on the larger and select medium broken at easier prices. Major blenders were very choosy and internal buyers were selective along with the upcountry buyers.
BUYING PATTERN: - The major blenders off take was 57.10% of the total CTC leaf sold.
ORTHODOX LEAF
DEMAND: - Good demand.
MARKET: - Well made clean high grown whole leaf sold steady to easier following quality. Other category at the lower end stalky teas declined largely whilst the clean teas sold steady. Broken grades too met with a similar trend. Fanning sold at irregular prices around last levels.
BUYING PATTERN: - Exporters & up country buyers continued to be fairly active closely following quality.
CTC DUST
DEMAND: - Reduced but slightly better compared to the CTC leaf.
MARKET: - CTC dust offer this week was at 502,130.61Kgs of which 393,559.44kgs were sold (78.38%). Best teas met with good demand and prices were irregularly dearer on all sorts closely following quality and competition. Good category bolder dust met with good demand and sold dearer on competition from local buyers. However, the finer dust declined sharply with some teas remaining unsold. Better medium & medium teas declined by Rs 2 to 3 initially but select few invoices settled at barely steady to easier prices as the sale progressed. Plainer teas met with lesser demand and prices were easier by Rs 3 to 5.
BUYING PATTERN: - Major blenders were fairly active. Regional and local packeteers were active on the best category teas. Up country and the local buyers were selective. Exporters were fairly active on the bolder dust especially on cleaner and blacker sorts as the sale progressed.
ORTHODOX DUST
DEMAND: - Fair, selective demand.
MARKET: - Primary dusts sold at irregular levels following quality, the lower end found buyers only at substantially easier levels following quality. Secondary teas sold at irregular levels.
BUYING PATTERN: - Regional & local packateers were fairly active on primary dusts. Exporters were selective on the secondary dusts.
Courtesy -J.Thomas & Co. Pvt. Ltd
